description: First arose in the 1730s, from big +â€Ž wig. Formerly, English men of authority wore wigs. Bigwig plays on the idea that higher authority is denoted by a larger wig.

entries.meaning: (humorous) A person of importance to a group or organization.
examples: Synonyms: big cheese, VIP; see also Thesaurus:important person
The company bigwig is gathering his staff together for a meeting today.
